content.text: An empty glass beaker has a mass of \(210 \text{g}\)
When \(200 \text{cm}^3\) of olive oil is poured into the beaker, the total mass is \(394 \text{g}\)
Calculate the density of the olive oil
density =
When the beaker and olive oil are heated, the olive oil expands
What happens to the density of the olive oil?
Describe what is meant by an echo
The speed of sound in water is \(1500 \text{m/s}\)
Calculate how long a sound wave takes to travel from the surface to the bottom of the river at a point \(300 \text{m}\) from A
A ship has \(3 \text{m}\) of itself below the surface of the water
From the figures in the table, estimate how close to A it can sail without hitting the bottom of the river
distance from A = .........\(m\)
Fig. 2.1 shows the mouth of a river, viewed from above. A and B are on opposite banks, and are \(800 \text{m}\) apart
Echo depth measurements use the time taken for sound to go from the surface bed and back again
Such measurements give the following values for the depth of the water at different distances from A, along the line AB
State what is meant by the _moment_ of a force
State, with a reason, which of the two positions, A or B, will enable him to close the door with least force

On another occasion, with the door in the position shown in Fig. 3.1, two workers each push on the door with the same force at the same time. One worker pushes at A, from the side seen in Fig. 3.1. The other worker pushes at B, from the other side of the door
Which way does the door move, if at all? Tick one box
A warehouse worker is about to close a large door, as shown in Fig. 3.1
State what is meant by the term melting point
Some ice has all reached its melting point, and it begins to melt. What happens to the temperature of the ice as it melts?

A certain substance has a melting point of \(- 10^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) (minus \(10^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)). A small amount of this substance is cooled from \(50^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) to \(- 18^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) in a very cold freezer unit
On Fig. 4.1, sketch a possible graph that shows how the temperature of the substance varies with time during the cooling process

What must be done to calibrate it
1. at \(0^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\),
2. at \(100^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)?

This circuit is to be used as a thermometer

1. the paths of the two rays in the air to the right of the lens,

The critical angle for the glass/air boundary is \(42^{\circ}\)
State what happens to the wavelength as the waves cross the boundary
State, giving your reasons, which side of the boundary, L or R, has the deeper water
Some more water is poured into the tank, and waves of the same frequency as before are generated in the tank
What difference, if any, will this make to the appearance of the waves
1. to the left of the boundary,
2. to the right of the boundary?
Water waves travel more slowly when the water is shallower, but the frequency does not change
Plane waves travel on the surface of some water in a tank. Fig. 7.1 shows the appear
above, of the waves before and after the boundary between two different depths of water tank
Two charged metal spheres are placed next to each other
indicates that the sphere is positively charged
indicates that the sphere is negatively charged
In the box alongside each pair of spheres, write attract or repel or no effect to describe the effect the spheres have on each other

The stream of water moves towards the plastic strip
